intro: Acinodendron francavillanum, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, hairy seeds. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Due to its rapid growth and adaptability, it can become invasive in certain regions.
